docs.lead_paragraph: In a landmark decision, an advisory committee of the Food and Drug Administration recommended today that food, most likely flour, be fortified with folic acid to prevent a common and devastating type of birth defect. If the advice is followed, it would be the first new fortification of a food since 1974, when iron was added to enriched flour to prevent iron deficiency anemia. It would also be the first fortification made to prevent a birth defect.

headline.main: Panel Recommends Adding Vitamin to Food to Prevent Birth Defect
